question: [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/config.move] [Function: new_price_feed()] [Default Enable] Line 234 defaults enable to true - can this allow newly created feeds to be used before they're properly configured? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/config.move] [Function: set_enable_to_price_feed()] [DoS Attack] Can an attacker repeatedly toggle enable to cause event spam and state inconsistencies? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/config.move] [Function: set_max_timestamp_diff_to_price_feed()] [Zero Value] Can max_timestamp_diff be set to 0, making all price updates immediately stale? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/config.move] [Function: set_max_timestamp_diff_to_price_feed()] [Max Value] Can max_timestamp_diff be set to u64::MAX, making staleness checks meaningless? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/config.move] [Function: set_max_timestamp_diff_to_price_feed()] [Race Condition] If max_timestamp_diff is reduced while price updates are being validated, can valid updates be rejected? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/config.move] [Function: set_max_duration_within_thresholds_to_price_feed()] [Duration Bypass] Can this be set to u64::MAX to allow indefinite price deviations? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/config.move] [Function: set_maximum_allowed_span_percentage_to_price_feed()] [Comment Validation] Line 36 comment says 'must (x * 10000)' suggesting percentage is in basis points - but no validation enforces this format. Can invalid values be set? (Medium)
